  • A1.8

    #Graph Theory
    2001

    (i) Show that any graph GGG with minimal degree δ\deltaδ contains a cycle of length at least δ+1\delta+1δ+1. Give examples to show that, for each possible value of δ\deltaδ, there is a graph with minimal degree δ\deltaδ but no cycle of length greater than δ+1\delta+1δ+1.

    (ii) Let KNK_{N}KN​ be the complete graph with NNN vertices labelled v1,v2,…,vNv_{1}, v_{2}, \ldots, v_{N}v1​,v2​,…,vN​. Prove, from first principles, that there are NN−2N^{N-2}NN−2 different spanning trees in KNK_{N}KN​. In how many of these spanning trees does the vertex v1v_{1}v1​ have degree 1 ?

    A spanning tree in KNK_{N}KN​ is chosen at random, with each of the NN−2N^{N-2}NN−2 trees being equally likely. Show that the average number of vertices of degree 1 in the random tree is approximately N/eN / eN/e when NNN is large.

    Find the average degree of vertices in the random tree.
